term.name: teleologism
term.source: From Greek telos: end or purpose, and from Greek logos: reason.
term.def: The view that ends or purposes are active, causative forces in the world, especially in the realm of biology (opposed to &darwinism;) and sometimes history (see &historicaldeterminism;).
Any theory holding that human beings can or should pursue goals such as individual fulfillment (as in &eudaimonism;).
